sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Sumtcita review:

ri'a = ?     bu'u = ?     pi'o = ?     bau = ?

(Answers: physical cause, at, using, in language)

New Material (5-7 min)

Describing Journeys

A: do klama ma
B: mi klama fa'a lo cmana
A: ki'u ma
B: ki'u lo nu melbi

(A: Where do you go? B: I go toward the mountain. A: Why? B: Because it's beautiful.)

Describing Methods

A: do cilre ta'i ma
B: mi cilre ta'i lo nu tcidu lo cukta
A: bau ma
B: bau la .jbobau.

(A: How do you learn? B: I learn by reading books. A: In what language? B: In Lojban.)

Describing Locations

A: do xabju bu'u ma
B: mi xabju bu'u lo stuzi poi ne'a lo rirxe
A: xu melbi
B: .ie ri melbi je calme

(A: Where do you live? B: I live at a place near the river. A: Is it beautiful? B: Yes, it's beautiful and calm.)

Key Point

Use sumtcita naturally in dialogue to add context about where, how, why, and in what language.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Complete the Dialogue

Fill in the blanks:

A: do gunka bu'u ma? B: mi gunka ___ lo zdani. A: pi'o ma? B: ___ lo skami.

Answers
  1. bu'u
  2. pi'o

Exercise 2: Create Dialogues

Write a short dialogue about:

  1. Going toward the sea because it's hot.
  2. Writing in English using a computer.
Example Answers 
A: do klama ma
B: mi klama fa'a lo xamsi
A: ki'u ma
B: ki'u lo nu glare

A: do ciska bau ma
B: mi ciska bau la .glibau.
A: pi'o ma
B: pi'o lo skami

Exercise 3: Translate

  1. I live near the mountain because I like it.
  2. Alice works at the station using a computer.
  3. I walk toward the field in the morning.
Answers
  1. mi xabju ne'a lo cmana mu'i lo nu mi nelci
  2. la .alis. cu gunka bu'u lo tcana pi'o lo skami
  3. mi cadzu fa'a lo foldi ca lo cerni

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Create your own dialogue using:

  • At least 2 sumtcita
  • At least 2 vocabulary words from this week

Example:

A: do klama fa'a ma
B: mi klama fa'a lo xamsi
A: mu'i ma
B: mu'i lo nu mi djica lo nu viska lo kevna
A: .ui xamgu

(A: Where are you going toward? B: I'm going toward the sea. A: Why? B: Because I want to see a cave. A: Great!)

Today's Practice

Conversation patterns:

Pattern Use
bu'u ma Where? (at)
fa'a ma Toward where?
ki'u ma Why? (justified by)
mu'i ma Why? (motivated by)
pi'o ma Using what?
bau ma In what language?

Summary

You practiced using sumtcita in natural conversation. Questions with ma work well with sumtcita.
